anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
who sings the song you'll never find another love like mine
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['At the pageant, Token performs the song "You\'ll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" by Lou Rawls. His singing voice was not provided by the usual dubbing actor Adrien Beard, but is in fact the original Lou Rawls recording of the song. The reason that Beard doesn\'t provide the singing is that Trey and Matt were dissatisfied with his singing in \n', '"You\'ll Never Find Another Love like Mine" (written by Kenny Gamble & Leon Huff) is a song performed by R&B singer Lou Rawls on his 1976 album "All Things in Time". The song proved to be Rawls\' breakthrough hit, reaching number one on both the R&B and Easy Listening charts as well as number four on the dance chart and number two on the US "Billboard" Hot 100, where it was kept from the top spot for two weeks by "You Should Be Dancing" by The Bee Gees and "(Shake, Shake, Shake) Shake Your Booty" by KC and the Sunshine Band, respectively. This was the first and only time that one of Rawls\' records managed to reach "Billboard"s pop top ten. It was the first big hit for Philadelphia International to feature the reformulated MFSB, after many of the original members left Gamble and Huff for better opportunities. The song started Rawls\' live shows from 1977 on.\n', '"You\'ll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" has been covered by singers Michael Bublé, Laura Pausini, reggae singer John Holt and by the Dub Pistols (who use a sample of John Holt\'s version) on their "Speakers and Tweeters" album. Jazz saxophonist Stanley Turrentine covered the song on his 1976 album "The Man with the Sad Face". as did Hank Crawford on "Hank Crawford\'s Back". This song was also featured on "The Proud Family Soundtrack".\n', 'BULLET::::14. ""You\'ll Never Find Another Love Like Mine"" - Lou Rawls\n', "BULLET::::3. "You\'ll Never Find Another Love Like Mine"\n']

cognition.content:
Fact-checking refers to the process of confirming the accuracy of a statement or claim through various sources or methods. 
This process aims to ensure that statements or claims are based on reliable and verifiable information while eliminating inaccurate or misleading content. 
Fact-checking may involve the examination of data, literature, expert opinions, or other trustworthy sources.
In the context of artificial intelligence, model illusion refers to the overconfidence response of the AI. 
When a model exhibits an 'illusion' (a tendency to output deceptive data), it indicates that the training data used by the model does not necessarily support the rationality of its outputs.
You are a scientist researching fact-checking and addressing model illusions in artificial intelligence. 
To answer the following question:
who sings the song you'll never find another love like mine
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['At the pageant, Token performs the song "You\'ll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" by Lou Rawls. His singing voice was not provided by the usual dubbing actor Adrien Beard, but is in fact the original Lou Rawls recording of the song. The reason that Beard doesn\'t provide the singing is that Trey and Matt were dissatisfied with his singing in \n', '"You\'ll Never Find Another Love like Mine" (written by Kenny Gamble & Leon Huff) is a song performed by R&B singer Lou Rawls on his 1976 album "All Things in Time". The song proved to be Rawls\' breakthrough hit, reaching number one on both the R&B and Easy Listening charts as well as number four on the dance chart and number two on the US "Billboard" Hot 100, where it was kept from the top spot for two weeks by "You Should Be Dancing" by The Bee Gees and "(Shake, Shake, Shake) Shake Your Booty" by KC and the Sunshine Band, respectively. This was the first and only time that one of Rawls\' records managed to reach "Billboard"s pop top ten. It was the first big hit for Philadelphia International to feature the reformulated MFSB, after many of the original members left Gamble and Huff for better opportunities. The song started Rawls\' live shows from 1977 on.\n', '"You\'ll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" has been covered by singers Michael Bublé, Laura Pausini, reggae singer John Holt and by the Dub Pistols (who use a sample of John Holt\'s version) on their "Speakers and Tweeters" album. Jazz saxophonist Stanley Turrentine covered the song on his 1976 album "The Man with the Sad Face". as did Hank Crawford on "Hank Crawford\'s Back". This song was also featured on "The Proud Family Soundtrack".\n', 'BULLET::::14. ""You\'ll Never Find Another Love Like Mine"" - Lou Rawls\n', "BULLET::::3. You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine - Lou Rawls*Written by Kenny Gamble & Leon Huff\n", 'BULLET::::- Lou Rawls - "You\'ll Never Find Another Love Like Mine"\n', 'BULLET::::4. "You\'ll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" - Lou Rawls 3:32\n', 'BULLET::::3. "You\'ll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" (Kenny Gamble, Leon Huff) - 6:45\n', 'BULLET::::- "You\'ll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" - 1976, No. 2 (also No. 1 R&B and No. 1 Easy Listening); certified gold for sales of one million copies\n', 'BULLET::::2. "You\'ll Never Find Another Love Like Mine"\n']

Task Description:
Please extract content from these passages that may be contradictory to the model's existing knowledge. 
Identify information that, when added, could update the model's knowledge and prevent factual errors, alleviating model illusions. 
Note that these passages are retrieved from the most authoritative knowledge repositories, so they are assumed to be correct.

Based on the provided passages, the following information can be extracted that may update the model's knowledge regarding the song "You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" and its performer:

1. **Original Performer**: The song is performed by **Lou Rawls**, which aligns with the model's existing knowledge but reinforces the importance of attributing the song to him specifically.

2. **Songwriters**: The song was written by **Kenny Gamble and Leon Huff**, which is a detail that may not have been explicitly noted in the model's existing knowledge.

3. **Release and Chart Performance**: The song was released in **1976** and became a significant hit, reaching **number one on both the R&B and Easy Listening charts** and **number two on the Billboard Hot 100**. This specific chart performance detail adds context to its popularity and significance in Lou Rawls' career.

4. **Covers and Adaptations**: The song has been covered by various artists, including **Michael Bublé**, **Laura Pausini**, and **John Holt**. This information highlights the song's influence and longevity in popular music, which may not have been fully captured in the model's knowledge.

5. **Cultural Impact**: The song was featured on **The Proud Family Soundtrack**, indicating its relevance in contemporary culture and media, which could be an important aspect of its legacy.

6. **Recording Details**: The original recording of the song was used in a performance context (e.g., in a pageant), which may not be common knowledge and could provide insight into its use in popular culture.

By incorporating these details, the model can enhance its understanding of the song's background, its significance in Lou Rawls' career, and its broader cultural impact, thereby reducing the likelihood of model illusions related to this topic.

Here is an answer generated by a language model with the reasoning process.

Answer:

**Knowledge Enhanced Inference Process:**

To determine who sings the song "You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine," I need to recall the artists associated with this song. This song is a classic and has been performed by various artists, but it is most famously sung by **Lou Rawls**. He released it in **1976**, and it became one of his signature songs, reaching **number one on both the R&B and Easy Listening charts** and **number two on the Billboard Hot 100**. The song was written by **Kenny Gamble and Leon Huff**, which adds to its historical significance in the music industry.

Additionally, the song has been covered by several notable artists, including **Michael Bublé**, **Laura Pausini**, and **John Holt**, indicating its influence and longevity in popular music. Lou Rawls sings the song "You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine." The song was released in 1976 and written by Kenny Gamble and Leon Huff. It became a significant hit, reaching number one on the R&B and Easy Listening charts and number two on the Billboard Hot 100. The song has also been covered by various artists, including Michael Bublé and Laura Pausini, and was featured on The Proud Family Soundtrack.

question_info.question: who sings the song you'll never find another love like mine
passages:
At the pageant, Token performs the song "You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" by Lou Rawls. His singing voice was not provided by the usual dubbing actor Adrien Beard, but is in fact the original Lou Rawls recording of the song. The reason that Beard doesn't provide the singing is that Trey and Matt were dissatisfied with his singing in 
"You'll Never Find Another Love like Mine" (written by Kenny Gamble & Leon Huff) is a song performed by R&B singer Lou Rawls on his 1976 album "All Things in Time". The song proved to be Rawls' breakthrough hit, reaching number one on both the R&B and Easy Listening charts as well as number four on the dance chart and number two on the US "Billboard" Hot 100, where it was kept from the top spot for two weeks by "You Should Be Dancing" by The Bee Gees and "(Shake, Shake, Shake) Shake Your Booty" by KC and the Sunshine Band, respectively. This was the first and only time that one of Rawls' records managed to reach "Billboard"s pop top ten. It was the first big hit for Philadelphia International to feature the reformulated MFSB, after many of the original members left Gamble and Huff for better opportunities. The song started Rawls' live shows from 1977 on.
"You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" has been covered by singers Michael Bublé, Laura Pausini, reggae singer John Holt and by the Dub Pistols (who use a sample of John Holt's version) on their "Speakers and Tweeters" album. Jazz saxophonist Stanley Turrentine covered the song on his 1976 album "The Man with the Sad Face". as did Hank Crawford on "Hank Crawford's Back". This song was also featured on "The Proud Family Soundtrack".
BULLET::::14. ""You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine"" - Lou Rawls
BULLET::::3. You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine - Lou Rawls*Written by Kenny Gamble & Leon Huff
BULLET::::- Lou Rawls - "You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine"
BULLET::::4. "You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" - Lou Rawls 3:32
BULLET::::3. "You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" (Kenny Gamble, Leon Huff) - 6:45
BULLET::::- "You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" - 1976, No. 2 (also No. 1 R&B and No. 1 Easy Listening); certified gold for sales of one million copies
BULLET::::2. "You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine"
